intro: Neophylum tenuiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered neophylum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine layer of hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Neophylum tenuiflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
